Package eu.iv4xr.framework.mainConcepts

Class TestAgent

java.lang.Object
nl.uu.cs.aplib.mainConcepts.BasicAgent
nl.uu.cs.aplib.agents.AutonomousBasicAgent
eu.iv4xr.framework.mainConcepts.TestAgent
public class TestAgent extends AutonomousBasicAgent
This class implements a test-agent. It extents AutonomousBasicAgent. All the functionalities of a test-agent fot being an agent are inherited for either BasicAgent or AutonomousBasicAgent. This class TestAgent adds some functionalities related to testing.

A test-agent is used to test some target system, also called System-Under-Test or SUT. From the test-agent's perspective, this SUT is seen as an environment the agent want to interact with. This implies that proper instance of the class Environment, or of one of its subclasses. must be placed between the agent and the SUT to facilitate the interactions between them.

The idea is that a test-agent interacts with the SUT in order to observe it. It is up to the test-agent to decide what are the circumstances worth observing. When it observes something notable, it can register this as a so-called observation event. There are several types of observations a test-agent can collect:

  • Verdicts. A verdict is an instance of ObservationEvent.VerdictEvent.
Author:
Wish

  • Constructor Details

    • TestAgent

      public TestAgent()
      Create a blank instance of TestAgent. To be useful you will need to add few other things to it, e.g. a state and a goal. You also need to link it to a TestDataCollector.

    • TestAgent

      public TestAgent​(String id, String role)
      Create a plain instance of TestAgent with the given id and role. To be useful you will need to add few other things to it, e.g. a state and a goal. You also need to link it to a TestDataCollector.

    • registerEvent

      public void registerEvent​(ObservationEvent.TimeStampedObservationEvent event)
      Register this event to be appended to a historical trace that this test agent keeps track.
      Parameters:
      event - Some event whose occurrence we want to keep track in a trace. The event will be time-stamped.

    • registerVerdict

      public void registerVerdict​(ObservationEvent.VerdictEvent verdict)
      Register a verdict, which can be either a success or fail, or undecided. Verdicts will also be put in this agent trace.
      Parameters:
      verdict - Representing the verdict.

    • update

      public void update()
      Description copied from class: BasicAgent
      Look for enabled actions within the current strategy that would be enabled on the current agent state. If there are none, the method returns. If there are multiple, the deliberation policy set by the method BasicAgent.useDeliberation(Deliberation) is used to choose one (the default is to just choose randomly). The chosen Action will then be executed for a single tick. If the Action returns a non-null proposal, this method will check is this proposal solves the current subgoal, it will be marked as such, and the next subgoal will be search. If there is none, then the topgoal is solved.

      This method also keeps track of the computation time so far used to work on the topgoal as well as the current subgoal. If this exceeds the allocated time, the corresponding topgoal/subgoal will be marked as failed.

      Overrides:
      update in class BasicAgent
